title: Valentine prompt with evasive No and Yes reveal (standalone + React)

requirements.summary: Refine standalone valentine.html into a single-purpose iPad-friendly Valentine prompt with exactly two choices (Yes/No) and English-only copy.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening /public/valentine.html shows a single Valentine question with only two buttons: Yes and No.
Layout is readable and usable on tablet-sized screens (iPad) without horizontal scrolling.
All user-visible copy in this page is in English.

file_operations.description: Tighten the standalone prompt UI to be single-purpose for iPad Chrome (ensure the question + exactly two buttons are the only interaction); remove/avoid any extra non-essential UI elements that distract from the prompt/reveal while keeping all visible copy in English.

requirements.summary: Ensure the standalone No button evasively moves on hover/touch and cannot be reliably clicked, while staying in-bounds and not overlapping Yes.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: moving the cursor over the No button causes it to jump to a different position.
On touch devices (iPad): attempting to press the No button causes it to move away (preventing a click).
No button stays within the visible bounds of its button area and does not overlap the Yes button.
The No button cannot be reliably clicked through normal interaction.

file_operations.description: Harden the evasive No behavior for both mouse and touch: add pointer/touch handling that prevents activation, keeps the button within the buttons container bounds, and retries random placement to avoid overlapping the Yes button.

requirements.summary: On Yes click, show the meme image and the full love letter in a scrollable, iPad-readable reveal view in both valentine.html and App.tsx.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Yes hides the question view and shows the reveal view.
Reveal view includes the meme image and the full love letter text (as paragraph blocks) and is readable on iPad (comfortable font size/line height).
Reveal view content is vertically scrollable so long text is accessible.
The same end-user behavior exists in the React app (frontend/src/App.tsx) and the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html).

file_operations.description: Update the Yes-click reveal to show (1) the meme image and (2) the complete user-provided love letter content as readable paragraph blocks within a vertically scrollable layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

Align the React Yes-click reveal view with the standalone behavior: display the meme image and full love letter paragraphs in a scrollable layout. Use the shadcn-ui ScrollArea component for vertical scrolling and the shadcn-ui Button component for consistent CTA styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent cartoonish romantic theme across the standalone page and React flow (warm palette, rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, friendly typography) without adding extra features.
acceptanceCriteria: Both flows (standalone HTML page and React app) share a coherent cartoonish-romantic styling approach (colors, rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows).
Theme does not introduce extra features beyond the Valentine prompt and the reveal view.
Typography and spacing remain readable on mobile/tablet.

file_operations.description: Adjust the standalone CSS to ensure a cohesive cartoonish-romantic theme (warm pink/red palette, rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, friendly typography) and maintain iPad readability without introducing new flows.

Refine Tailwind class usage so the React prompt + reveal matches the same cartoonish-romantic styling approach as the standalone page while remaining focused on the question and reveal. Continue using shadcn-ui Button and ScrollArea where already present. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add the generated meme image to frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it from both valentine.html and App.tsx using the exact filename.
acceptanceCriteria: The file frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png exists and is loadable in the browser.
frontend/public/valentine.html references the image via a relative path that works when opening the file via the app’s static hosting.
No backend endpoints are added for image delivery.

file_operations.description: Add the static generated image asset at the exact path/filename so it can be served by static hosting (no backend involvement).

Ensure the standalone reveal view references the image using a relative static path that resolves under the app’s static hosting: frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png.
Ensure the React reveal view references the image at /assets/generated/valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png and that it renders correctly within the reveal layout.
